pullrequest.title: Preparations for apps to be restructured as standard Python packages

content.raw:
Oh, and I didn’t answer the second question. The working directory used to be the directory of each program, i.e. the BLACS directory. Now that those are moving to site-packages, the app directory is pretty far away from anything relevant to the user, plus having it as the working directory can prevent it being deleted, e.g. when conda updates a package, even if the application is not holding any files open in the directory.

It’s userlib now as an alternative, since that’s where the user’s stuff is. In principle this shouldn’t matter since it shouldn’t come up anywhere, but if we fail to set the default directory for a file-open dialog or something, it will use userlib so it’s a good fallback.

Another alternative could be the user’s home directory.
